Doc: A type describing a commodity performance swap in which one leg pays out based on the return on a reference commodity index or commodity reference price.

Source.Contents:
/#
   A type describing a commodity performance swap in which one leg pays out based on the return on a reference commodity index or commodity reference price.
 #/
record FpML5.recordkeeping.CommodityPerformanceSwap {
  # A classification of the most important risk class of the trade. FpML defines a simple asset class categorization using a coding scheme.
  primaryAssetClass : string

  # A classification of additional risk classes of the trade, if any. FpML defines a simple asset class categorization using a coding scheme.
  secondaryAssetClass : string?

  # A classification of the type of product. FpML defines a simple product categorization using a coding scheme.
  productType : string

  # A product reference identifier. The product ID is an identifier that describes the key economic characteristics of the trade type, with the exception of concepts such as size (notional, quantity, number of units) and price (fixed rate, strike, etc.) that are negotiated for each transaction. It can be used to hold identifiers such as the "UPI" (universal product identifier) required by certain regulatory reporting rules. It can also be used to hold identifiers of benchmark products or product temnplates used by certain trading systems or facilities. FpML does not define the domain values associated with this element. Note that the domain values for this element are not strictly an enumerated list.
  productId : string

  # Describes the type of any embedded optionality in the transaction that might not otherwise be apparent. Can be used to represent embedded optionality such as early termination provisions, extendible provisions, or cancelable provisions, etc., where applicable. If omitted, no embedded optionality is applicable.
  embeddedOptionType : string?

  # Specifies the Eeffective Date of the swap. It is an optional element because not all confirmations of total return swaps specify an Effective Date. In these cases the Term of the contract begins on the Trade Date.
  effectiveDate : FpML5.recordkeeping.AdjustableOrRelativeDate?

  # Specifies the Termination Date of the swap.
  terminationDate : FpML5.recordkeeping.AdjustableOrRelativeDate?

  # The currency in which the commodity performance swap transaction will settle. It is an optional element because not all confirmations of performance swaps specify a Settlement Currency.
  settlementCurrency : string?

  # A placeholder within 'commodityPerformanceSwap' structure for the actual commodity swap legs (e.g. 'commodityReturnLeg' and 'commodityInterestLeg').
  commodityPerformanceSwapLeg : FpML5.recordkeeping.CommodityPerformanceSwapLeg?

  # If Common Pricing is elected (“true”) for a Transaction with referencing more than one Commodity Reference Price then no date will be a Pricing Date unless such a date is a day on which all Commodity Reference Prices are scheduled to be published.
  commonPricing : boolean?

  # Contains contract terms related to triggers and responses to market disruptions as defined in the 1993 or 2005 Commodity Definitions.
  marketDisruption : FpML5.recordkeeping.CommodityMarketDisruption?

  # Describes contract terms related to the consequences of Bullion Settlement Disruption Events.
  settlementDisruption : string?

  # Rounding direction and precision for amounts.
  rounding : FpML5.recordkeeping.Rounding?

  # Specifies, for one or for both the parties to the trade, the date prior to the Termination Date from which the contract can be terminated.
  earlyTermination : FpML5.recordkeeping.CommodityPerformanceSwapEarlyTermination?

  id : string?

}

primaryAssetClass.Name: primaryAssetClass

secondaryAssetClass.Doc: A classification of additional risk classes of the trade, if any. FpML defines a simple asset class categorization using a coding scheme.

It can be used to hold identifiers such as the "UPI" (universal product identifier) required by certain regulatory reporting rules. It can also be used to hold identifiers of benchmark products or product temnplates used by certain trading systems or facilities. FpML does not define the domain values associated with this element. If omitted, no embedded optionality is applicable.
embeddedOptionType.Name: embeddedOptionType

settlementCurrency.Doc: The currency in which the commodity performance swap transaction will settle. It is an optional element because not all confirmations of performance swaps specify a Settlement Currency.
settlementCurrency.Name: settlementCurrency

commodityPerformanceSwapLeg.Doc: A placeholder within 'commodityPerformanceSwap' structure for the actual commodity swap legs (e.g. 'commodityReturnLeg' and 'commodityInterestLeg').
commodityPerformanceSwapLeg.Name: commodityPerformanceSwapLeg

commonPricing.Name: commonPricing

marketDisruption.Name: marketDisruption

earlyTermination.Name: earlyTermination
